title: Voting for Event Tech Live’s crowdsourced content is now live
text:
Voting for Event Tech Live’s crowdsourced content is now live Voting for Event Tech Live’s crowdsourced content is now live Details Category: Show   16:30 A.M.P. Events Ltd, the organiser of Event Tech Live has today announced that voting for crowdsourced content at the 2015 show is now live. The online voting process puts attendees in the driving seat when it comes to selecting the majority of the topics and speakers that will make up the finalised educational programme. 
urrently Europe’s only dedicated exhibition and conference for event professionals with an interest in event technology, Event Tech Live will take place at the Old Truman Brewery, London on November 11th 2015. With more than 30 applications from all over the world received for the ‘Campfire’ and ‘Tech Demo’ sessions, the event will undoubtedly have global appeal. Speaking on the crowdsourcing model Adam Parry, director of A.M.P. Events Ltd commented: “It’s important to us that our attendees have a say in the content delivered at Event Tech Live. The whole ethos of the event is to meet the thirst for knowledge on event technology by delivering informative sessions, demonstrations and practical advice. Crowdsourcing offers delegates a unique opportunity to choose the topics and speakers that they see at the event and ensure that we have relevant content that meets attendee requirements. Interested parties can cast their votes at http://www.eventtechlive.com/vote/ from today until 13th October. Event professionals can register for Event Tech Live by visiting www.eventtechlive.com. The Event Technology Awards will take place on the evening of 11th November, following Event Tech Live, at pop-up venue Supernova, Embankment, London. Related articles
